input:
What brings you in today?**PATIENT CHARACTER:** Patient with Other specified paraneoplastic or autoimmune disorders of the nervous system

ROLEPLAY SCRIPT:
YOU ARE A PATIENT: YOU ARE A 45-YEAR-OLD WOMAN
You are experiencing the following symptoms:
- Cognitive decline and forgetfulness
- Occasional visual hallucinations
- Increasing agitation and irritability
- Seizures, which have become more frequent over the past two weeks
THESE SYMPTOMS CAME INTO FRUITION:
Gradually over the past three weeks, I started noticing that I was forgetting recent conversations and misplacing things more often. Then, last week, I began seeing faint shapes and shadows that no one else could see, which really unsettled me. My mood has also become more irritable and abrupt, and I’ve had a couple of seizures that knocked me out briefly — I felt confused afterward. I come from a family where autoimmune issues are common, and I’ve had some minor infections like EBV in the past, so I’m worried this might be related.
output:
THINKING: I need to explain my symptoms clearly, but I might be a bit confused about the timeline and how everything is connected. I want to be honest about what I’ve noticed without overexplaining. I also want
ANSWER: Well, I’m 45 and I’m a woman. I guess I came because, you know, I’ve been forgetting things a lot more than before, like recent stuff or appointments, and it sort of feels like my mind is slipping. Then, last week or so, I started seeing shadows or shapes that no one else can see — it’s pretty scary. My mood’s been really irritable, and I’ve had a couple of seizures recently that kinda knocked me out and left me very confused afterward. I’m worried it might be related to some autoimmune thing, ’cause my family has had issues like that, and I’ve had infections before, like with EBV. It’s all just been happening gradually and I don’t really understand what’s going on.
